example_sentences.eng_trans: We played cards. ｜ We played a card game.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 僕たちはトランプをして遊んだ.

example_sentences.eng_trans: I entertained myself by looking at picture books.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 私は絵本を見てひとりで遊んだ.

example_sentences.eng_trans: We enjoyed ourselves by singing old songs.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 私たちは懐かしい歌を歌って遊んだ.

example_sentences.eng_trans: If young children play with older children they grow up [mature] more quickly.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 子供は年上の子供に遊んでもらうと成長が早い.

example_sentences.eng_trans: I love to play with children and want to become a nursery school teacher.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 私は子供と遊ぶのが大好きで, 将来は保母になりたいと思っています.

example_sentences.eng_trans: What do you want to play today?
example_sentences.jap_sentence: ねえ, 今日は何して遊ぶ?

example_sentences.eng_trans: What do you say you join us tomorrow for a day of fun and relaxation?
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 明日来て僕らと一日遊ばないか.

example_sentences.eng_trans: Let's play together again tomorrow, okay?
example_sentences.jap_sentence: あしたまた僕と遊ぼ.

example_sentences.eng_trans: You're nuts if you think I'm gonna play with you anymore. ➡最後の you に強勢を置く.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: もうお前なんかと遊ぶもんか.

example_sentences.eng_trans: Children are playing in the field.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 子供たちが野原で遊んでいる.

example_sentences.eng_trans: Right now they are absorbed in playing video games.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼らは今テレビゲームに夢中になって遊んでいる.

example_sentences.eng_trans: The children are having a merry time. ｜ The children seem to be having a good time playing (together).
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 子供たちは楽しそうに遊んでいる.

example_sentences.eng_trans: We had a very good [nice] time. ｜ We had a lot of fun. ｜ We had a great time.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: われわれは非常に愉快に遊んだ.

example_sentences.eng_trans: My children don't play outdoors as much as they used to.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: うちの子は前ほど戸外で遊ばなくなりました.

example_sentences.eng_trans: It's not good to study all the time, you need to play sometimes, too.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 勉強ばかりしていないでたまには遊んだほうがいい.

example_sentences.eng_trans: Working all the time without relaxing [playing] at all is not good for you.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 働いてばかりで少しも遊ばないのはよくない.

example_sentences.eng_trans: Study hard, play hard.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: よく学び, よく遊べ.

example_sentences.eng_trans: Play nicely together without fighting!
example_sentences.jap_sentence: けんかしないで仲よく遊びなさい.

example_sentences.eng_trans: Pick everything up after you finish playing.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 遊んだあとはきちんと片づけましょう.

example_sentences.eng_trans: Mari, let's play!
example_sentences.jap_sentence: マリちゃん, あそぼ[あそびましょ].

example_sentences.eng_trans: How do you play with this?
example_sentences.jap_sentence: これどうやって遊ぶの?

example_sentences.eng_trans: We want to eat while we play, so please make us sandwiches for lunch.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 遊びながら食べたいからお昼はサンドイッチにしてちょうだい.

example_sentences.eng_trans: We planned to visit Kyoto the first day, Nara the second, and then return on the evening of the third day.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 私たちは 1 日目は京都, 2 日目は奈良で遊んで, 3 日目の夕方に帰る旅行計画を立てた.

example_sentences.eng_trans: We planned to spend one day in autumn in [looking around] the old capital.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 私たちは秋の一日古都に遊ぶ計画を立てた.

example_sentences.eng_trans: I wove a tapestry showing butterflies fluttering around flowers.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 私は花に遊ぶ蝶を図案化したタペストリーを織った.

example_sentences.eng_trans: This pond is an oasis in the city where many waterfowl come and go as they wish.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: この池はたくさんの水鳥が遊ぶ都会のオアシスです.

example_sentences.eng_trans: She has a piece of blank paper in front of her and is letting her imagination run free.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼女は今白い紙を前にして空想の世界に遊んでいる.

example_sentences.eng_trans: The starry sky gives our minds plenty of opportunity to enjoy free play on the boundary between fantasy and science.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 星空は空想と科学の境界で遊ぶ楽しさを存分に与えてくれる.

example_sentences.eng_trans: He's not even trying to get a job and is just loafing around the house.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼は就職しようともせず家でぶらぶら遊んでいる.

example_sentences.eng_trans: He has enough of a fortune to spend the rest of his life without working.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼には一生遊んで暮らせるだけの財産がある.

example_sentences.eng_trans: This is a rich country, where if you work for one year you can take the next year off.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: ここは 1 年働けば 1 年遊んでいられる豊かな国だ.

example_sentences.eng_trans: I feel guilty for getting paid without doing any work.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 遊んでいて金をもらうのは申し訳ない.

example_sentences.eng_trans: We poor people cannot afford not to work. ｜ We poor people cannot afford to be idle.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: われわれ貧乏人は遊んでなどいられない.

example_sentences.eng_trans: 〔無駄に過ごした〕 I haven't done a thing today. ｜ I have been loafing all day.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 今日はすっかり遊んでしまった.

example_sentences.eng_trans: When winter came, the cricket, who had played all summer long, came to the ant's home to ask for help.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 夏の間遊んでいたキリギリスは冬になってアリさんの家へ助けを求めてやってきました.

example_sentences.eng_trans: The pitcher wasted one pitch and then went for the (third) strike.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: ツーストライクを取ったあとピッチャーは一球遊んでから勝負に出た.

parts: (定職につかないで) fail to get a steady job
(職場などでまともに仕事をせずに) goof off on the job

example_sentences.eng_trans: If we (choose to) go bowling, we can play for one thousand yen an hour.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: ボウリングなら 1 時間 1,000 円で遊べる.

example_sentences.eng_trans: Hey, do you know of any place where they have girls.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 女の子と遊べる店を紹介してよ.

example_sentences.eng_trans: He has sown his wild oats. ｜ He played around a lot when he was younger.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: あの人は若い時にずいぶん遊んだ.

example_sentences.eng_trans: He has settled down after a wild youth. ｜ He played around when he was young, but he's settled down now.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 若い時は遊んだが今では落ち着いた.

example_sentences.eng_trans: Entertainers, go and enjoy yourselves. Enjoy yourselves, and then use the experience to enrich your performances.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 芸人は遊びなさい. 遊んでそれを芸に生かすんだ.

example_sentences.eng_trans: Let's have a really good time [really live it up, let it all out] today.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 今日はとことん遊ぼうじゃないか.

example_sentences.eng_trans: He admitted that he had broken in intending to steal because he wanted money to have a good time.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼は遊ぶ金が欲しくて盗みに入ったと自供した.

example_sentences.eng_trans: When he was young he spent three years studying in Germany.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼は若いころ(研学のため)3 年間ドイツに遊んだ.

example_sentences.eng_trans: He studied under Yasui Sokken, the noted scholar then living in Hyūga.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼は日向在の碩学安井息軒の門に遊んだ.

example_sentences.eng_trans: We have some machines that are standing idle [not being used], so I'll let you borrow them.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 遊んでいる機械があるから貸してあげましょう.

example_sentences.eng_trans: They decided to use the vacant lot for a parking lot.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 遊んでいる土地を駐車場にすることにした.

example_sentences.eng_trans: That will leave some people with nothing to do; let's assign the tasks so everyone has one.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: それでは遊んでいる人ができる. みんなに仕事を割り振りましょう.

example_sentences.eng_trans: You're not using your left hand for anything; hold your bowl with it when you're eating.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 左手が遊んでいるよ. 茶碗を持って食べなさい.

example_sentences.eng_trans: Don't you realize he's just toying with you [leading you on]?
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 君は彼に遊ばれているのがわからないのか.
